weight/yardage 50g-1 75oz/148m-160yds knitting weight worsted or one ball of berocco blackstone tweed 65% wool 25% mohair 10% angora weight/yardage 50g-1 75oz/119m-130yds knitting weight worsted note if you are making the large size you will need a second ball of yarn needles 4- dpn 3mm there is no american or canadian equivalent if you have to work with the larger or smaller only by 25mm on either side just accommodate by perhaps choosing a different size to knit notions waste yarn tapestry needle sizes small medium and large circumference is 6 5 7 and 7 5 inches and length to meet pattern requirements and with the exception of the large size to use only one 50g ball 8 inches or 20 cm gauge 27 sts = 4 inches or 10 cm 32 row = 4 inches or 10 cm in the 3 x 1 rib pattern these mitts are knit in the round the thumb gusset grows from the stitches on needle one using m1l make one left and m1r make one right increases make two identical mitts instructions cast on 40st 44 48 onto dpns using whatever cast on technique that you like for a mitten they all work equally well join in the round being careful not to twist the stitches distribute stitches on three needles as follows small 40sts 12 12 16 med 44sts 12 16 16 large 48sts 16 16 16 1 | ©d iana t w iss 2 01 4 100 m ile w ear c om place a marker one stitch into the knitting on needle one to mark the beginning of the round and make note of needle one cuff knit a 3 x 1 rib k3 p1 for 3 5 inches or preferred length note if you are making the large size and want a cuff longer than 3 5 you will need a second ball of yarn make the thumb gusset increases for the thumb gusset will happen in the second rib on needle one needle one k3 p1 k1 m1l k1 m1r k1 p1 *k3 p1* for the remainder of the round instructions in the square brackets are for the thumb gusset knit two rounds in pattern *k3 p1* taking note of the newly created stitches on needle one and knitting them this mean that on rounds two and three this is what needle one will look like k3 p1 k5 p1 k3 p1 the knit stitches in brackets are the thumb gusset continue on the rest of the round with *k3 p1 * every third round make increases for the thumb
